primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God transforms human malice (schemes) into divine salvation (plans) through the life of Joseph and the history of nations.

tekstueel_bewijs: A hand, not human, seems to be ordering his destiny
God took their scheme and breathed on it his plan
God will reward, and God will punish
a great moment of reconciliation and forgiveness
The issues of life are finally in God's hands

ontvanger.identificatie: The family of Israel / The American Nation
tekstueel_bewijs: We need some means of cleansing our past
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one needing cleansing/deliverance).

tekstueel_bewijs: Joseph... becomes a great man and is delivered by the will of God
This... is what the gospel is all about
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Joseph is the Mediator/Helper.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal sin but systemic 'schemes' that threaten the 'nation's soul'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The American nation must address its racial past to avoid destruction.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Black and White Americans
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The social crisis is framed as a modern 'scheme' that requires the same divine 'plan' logic found in Joseph's story.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Transformation of Evil into Good

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must learn to appeal to him
Negroes have a fearful decision to make

voorbeelden: We must learn to appeal to him
Whites need to admit their failure
Joseph's foresight... more than the educated guess
He can destroy, and he will defend
God takes the scheme of hurting and makes it heal

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Pouvoir' (Power) to override human 'Devoir' (Failure) and 'Vouloir' (Malice).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The brothers' plot) to S1 (God's deliverance), then applies this to the ~S1 of the American racial crisis.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God 'breathes' His plan onto the scheme, subsuming evil into a greater good.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is described as 'sinister,' 'ugly,' and 'haunting'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong ethical imperatives for the nation, the underlying engine is theocentric: God is the one who redirects history and heals the past.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Exemplarism in the application to youth
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What you are tomorrow will largely depend on what you are today.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the primary actor in redemption
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It was God who sent me hither... to prepare a great deliverance.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joseph is used as a model of forgiveness, but his success is explicitly attributed to God's hand.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by stating 'Am I in the place of God?'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe at God's sovereignty over personal and national failure.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes and enables social ethics.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Joseph narrative to the American racial crisis is structurally seamless through the 'Scheme vs Plan' motif.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God's plan' and the 'fearful decision' Negroes must make.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God takes the scheme of hurting and makes it heal... a Christian is unbeatable.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Providence rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The section on youth choices leans toward the hearer as Subject of their own destiny.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the one whose life is 'in God's hands' even in their mistakes.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Frame youth choices as responses to God's plan rather than the sole architects of their future.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong Devoir in the social application.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (God's power to heal the nation).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that God's plan for the nation is what enables the 'costly purging act'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (racism/sin) is already portrayed as a 'sick giant'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (God saves Joseph -> God can save America) is sound.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of using a structural motif (Scheme vs Plan) to bridge biblical narrative and urgent social commentary without losing theocentric focus.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'purple-back book' pathos; Greimas reveals the 'Scheme/Plan' actantial conflict.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Hebrew of Genesis 50; this analysis focuses on the functional roles of God and Man in the story's engine.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Scheme' is actually a 'Counter-Subject' that God (the Subject) incorporates into His own 'Object' (Deliverance).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the American definition of 'scheme' to create a semiotic opposition between human 'shrewdness' and divine 'wisdom'.
